Description: Painted pottery reis shabti with a black curled lappet-wig, a brown modelled face(worn); the chest and crossed arms in relief are yellow, the hands are brown; the figure wears a white pleated triangular apron in two tiers, the lower of which is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs(now illegible) on yellow ground that extends to between the feet.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
